column4: i am trying to setup my keyboard so that the windows key works, but in gnome when i go to system > preferences>keyboard>layout options, it is just blank. has anyone experienced this?
what problem Bonez56 ?
you need to go to system>preferences>keyboard>layout options tab and set the second one down Alt/Win Key behaviour I think
yea but that page is blank. its empty ...
what keyboard model do you have listed under the layouts tab?
Keyboard model unknown and when i click '...', there os nothing listed
is the keyboard working at all?
most of it... not the numpad or any 'special' buttons
it looks like you have no keyboards installed so it is defaulting to a basic minimum, gimmie a sec
do you have these in your /etc/X11/xorg.conf  http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/18719
yea i have: http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/18720
do sudo updatedb then do locate kbd please
locate kbd comes up with a lot of stuff
i can run a 'find' if you know the filename
but you have a kbd.so listed right?
/usr/lib/ggi/input/linux_kbd.so
there is something funky going on can you try and do a sudo apt-get install  xserver-xorg-input-kbd
it says that it is already the latest version
I have taken you as far as I can, someone else will need to help you from here, I have never dealt with an issue like this before, sorry bud
np. thanks for trying
did you manage to get your keyboard problem solved
